pros: SSW supports it's employees in all aspects, truly being people-centred. It provides employees with a lot of autonomy and opportunity to make a difference to the hospital's we serve.
cons: Slightly on the smaller side, opportunities for advancement aren't as plentiful. That said, SSW always prioritizes promoting from within and those with career goals and objectives are very supported to achieve them.

pros: work/life balance. Great, smart people to work with every day. Meaningful work.

pros: Family culture, supportive leadership, fair salary

pros:
SSW is an organization which encourages the best out of its employees. The leadership is open to new ideas, will action positive changes, and encourages the development of its people. 

Personally, every request I had to learn other aspects of supply chain was met with encouragement and action plans in order to fulfill my desire to learn. Many times my manager took on my responsibilities so that I could shadow and develop. I used this knowledge to better complete my duties and communicate to my employees with a better understanding of the 'big picture'. 

The mentality of SSW in terms of work ethic is to get the job done - no matter where you're located. The flexibility to show up when needed rather than a hard start and finish time helped my family life immensely. There are times I had to work at home after the kids went down, but it was a tradeoff to coming in late in the morning. 

The people here are a family and will assist with requests if they are able. Everyone wants to see everyone succeed because they understand that their success is the success of the clinicians, patients, and taxpayers. We all want to bring value to the Healthcare Supply Chain.
cons: None worth mentioning.  Every job and their knit picking but there are no major cons that would improve performance.

pros: Then people are amazing , supportive and inspirational. The environment is family (and pet) friendly. Lots of opportunity for career growth . The leaders are open to new ideas . The culture is open and transparent . A non management representative is elected to the Leadership Team every year. Student development is a part of the culture with MBA co-op students part of the team. Flexible work arrangements and working from home opportunity.
cons: Workload requires excellent time management skills and can sometimes be challenging because health care work never takes a break. Office space is at a premium because the team is growing with new hires. Travelling to hospital sites across the region/province and Toronto takes up a lot of time.

review_title: Overall Nice People and Good Experience to Date
pros: Very flexible regarding work / home life balance.  Friendly staff members.  Good benefit package.
cons:
Senior Leadership teams seems to be aligned however there is a huge drop-off when you get to the Manager level.  I’m not sure how some of the managers got their job or for that matter keep their job.
I’m also not sure why we had to move our office away from our customer base. It makes it extremely difficult for many of us to continue to have on-site customer meetings now that we are so far away.

pros: SSW supports their staff and personal development.  They promote from within and allow employees to transfer to different disciplines to gain on hand knowledge to reach their career goals.  The culture is amazing and the people are great.
cons: SSW is a high achieving organization. To work here you have to be high energy and motivated to do a good job.  Must be able to prioritize  and be a leader.

review_title: The grass is green on our side!
pros: Family-like culture; sincere focus on employees growth, development, and personal fulfilment; constant opportunities to push own boundaries to achieve Personal Best; wonderful co-workers; strategic focus on making a difference in the community we serve.
cons: Workload can be overwhelming at times.  It requires real effort and discipline to balance work and life.

pros: SSW provides employees with lot's of opportunity to take on new challenges.  They often promote from within and employees progress at SSW.
cons: SSW coordinates the sourcing of hospitals in the Peel Halton regions.  Hospital customers can be challenging to coordinate.

pros: friendly working environment,   life and work can be balanced
